thread.title: Sharks place Couture on IR, recall F Lerg
thread.title_full: Sharks place Couture on IR, recall F Lerg

title: Sharks place Couture on IR, recall F Lerg
text:
Sharks place Couture on IR, recall F Lerg Forward underwent surgery to repair broken fibula UPDATED 1:15 PM CDT Oct 19, 2015 Photos Christian Petersen/Getty Images 
The San Jose Sharks placed forward Logan Couture placed on injured reserve Monday after he underwent surgery to repair a broken right fibula. Ex-coach: Lamar Odom breathing on... 
The team also recalled forward Bryan Lerg from the San Jose Barracuda of the American Hockey League. Lerg could be in the lineup when the Sharks play the New York Rangers on Monday night at Madison Square Garden. 
Couture sustained the injury in practice last Thursday. He is expected to miss four to six weeks. The injury occurred during a 5-on-5 drill when Couture fell in the corner. After taking several moments to sit up, he was helped off of the ice by teammates. 
Couture, in his seventh season with the Sharks, has one assist and a plus-1 rating in three games. 
Lerg, 29, has posted two goals and six shots on goal in three games as the captain of the Barracuda, ranking second on the team in goals. He posted 41 points (13 goals, 28 assists) in 68 games with Worcester last season, and scored one goal in two games with the Sharks. The 5-foot-10, 175-pound native of Livonia, Mich., was signed as a free agent by San Jose on July 10, 2014.
